oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Atlas of the city of Nashville 1908. [Plate 25A]
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 1 map; 58 x 75 cm. A plat map of downtown Nashville, Tennessee and the surrounding area, originally published in 1908 by G. M. Hopkins Company, showing the various buildings, landscapes, acreage, and street routes for several blocks. Original building structures are depicted on the map, such as the Parthenon replica, an erecting shop, a planning mill, a repair shop, a blacksmith shop, a machine shop, a boiler shop and a coach shed. Also shown is Centennial Park and Lake Watauga, a small artificial lake on the park grounds. Portions of the Nashville, Chattanooga, and St. Louis Railway are also depicted. This plat map is reproduced from the source: Atlas of the city of Nashville, Tennessee : from official records, private plans and actual surveys, G. M. Hopkins, [Philadelphia, Pa.] 1908. Scale 200 feet to an inch. The original dimensions of the map, in the atlas publication: 15 1/2 x 22 3/4 in. (i.e. 58 x 75 cm.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Parthenon (Art museum : Nashville, Tenn.); Nashville, Chattanooga, and St. Louis Railway
